1 = Victoria can scrape prometheus

panels.title: Prometheus Up

options.content:
# Prometheus Storage Overview
Prometheus uses a high-performance local **Time-Series Database (TSDB)** to store metrics data. Key features include:

- **Append-Only Writes**: Ensures minimal wear on storage by appending new data.
- **Efficient Compression**: Uses optimized data structures for high compression.
- **Retention Policies**: Allows for configurable data retention and cleanup.
- **WAL and Blocks**: Data is written to the Write-Ahead Log (WAL) and eventually moved to block storage for durability.

For more information, visit the [Prometheus Storage Documentation](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/storage/).

# Write-Ahead Log (WAL)
The WAL is the first stop for incoming data. It logs all new data for quick appending and crash recovery.

### Key Details:
- **Purpose**: Logs new data, enabling recovery if Prometheus crashes.
- **Truncation**: WAL segments are truncated periodically to limit size.
- **Replay**: During a restart, Prometheus replays the WAL to ensure all recent data is saved to storage.
- **Checkpoint**: Creates periodic snapshots of the current data state, reducing WAL size.


### WAL Configuration Example
#### WAL Segment Size (`--storage.tsdb.wal-segment-size`)
Controls the size of each WAL segment file, which stores recent time-series data before it’s committed to blocks.

- **Default**: `128MB`
- **Purpose**: Larger segment sizes reduce the number of WAL files, improving read performance but increasing disk usage.
- **Configuration Example**:
  ```yaml
  --storage.tsdb.wal-segment-size=64MB

# Block Storage
Prometheus periodically compacts recent data into **blocks** to reduce storage size and speed up querying.

### Key Points:
- **Block Creation**: By default, Prometheus creates a new block every 2 hours.
- **Compaction**: Merges smaller blocks into larger ones, optimizing for query speed.
- **Metadata and Indexing**: Each block has an index for quick lookups.

### Example Block Storage Configuration
```yaml
# Configure block duration and retention time
--storage.tsdb.min-block-duration=2h
--storage.tsdb.retention.time=90d
```

[Choose right retention Size](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/storage/#right-sizing-retention-size)

panels.description:
This metric increases when the labels from scraped metrics for a particular scrape pool exceed the configured limits on:

The number of labels per metric series.
The maximum length of individual label names.
The maximum length of individual label values.
When these limits are exceeded, Prometheus will drop the affected samples and increment this counter, indicating that some of the scraped data could not be ingested due to violating the label
panels.title: Target Labels Exceeded

When these limits are exceeded, Prometheus will drop the affected samples and increment this counter, indicating that some of the scraped data could not be ingested due to violating the label
panels.title: Targets Scrape Duration Seconds

panels.description: The number of samples the target exposed.
panels.title: Targets Samples Scraped Rate $interval

panels.description:
Metric Definition: This metric tracks the number of samples from each scrape target after relabeling has been applied. Relabeling in Prometheus allows you to modify, filter, or drop metrics as they are being scraped, based on matching label criteria.

Relabeling: Relabeling is commonly used to:

Drop unnecessary metrics.
Rename labels or metrics.
Control the cardinality (number of unique time series).
Prevent high cardinality or large volumes of unnecessary data from overwhelming Prometheus.
panels.title: Post metric Relabelling

panels.description:
Metric Definition: This metric tracks the number of samples from each scrape target after relabeling has been applied. Relabeling in Prometheus allows you to modify, filter, or drop metrics as they are being scraped, based on matching label criteria.

Relabeling: Relabeling is commonly used to:

Drop unnecessary metrics.
Rename labels or metrics.
Control the cardinality (number of unique time series).
Prevent high cardinality or large volumes of unnecessary data from overwhelming Prometheus.
panels.title: Post metric Relabelling Rate( $interval )

panels.description:
Metric Definition: The prometheus_tsdb_wal_completed_pages_total metric counts the total number of completed pages in the WAL. In the context of WAL, a page refers to a fixed-size block of data that is written to storage.

Completed Pages: This metric tracks how many pages have been successfully written and finalized in the WAL over time. This helps in understanding the volume of data being processed and how effectively the WAL is managing data writes.
panels.title: WAL Completed Pages

panels.description:
What Does prometheus_tsdb_wal_page_flushes_total Measure?
Metric Definition: The prometheus_tsdb_wal_page_flushes_total metric counts the total number of times that pages in the WAL have been flushed to disk. A page in this context refers to a fixed-size block of data that is written to the WAL.

Flushing: Flushing a page involves writing its contents from memory to disk, ensuring that the data is safely stored and can be recovered in case of a crash. This process is critical for maintaining data integrity.
panels.title: WAL Flushed Pages

panels.description:
What Does prometheus_tsdb_wal_writes_failed_total Measure?
Metric Definition: The prometheus_tsdb_wal_writes_failed_total metric counts the total number of failed write attempts to the WAL. A failed write could occur for various reasons, such as:

Disk space issues
File system permissions errors
Hardware failures
Corrupted WAL files
panels.title: WAL Writes Failed Total

panels.description:
Metric Definition: The prometheus_tsdb_wal_segment_current metric indicates the current segment number of the WAL. The WAL is divided into segments, and each segment represents a fixed size of data that can be written. When a segment is filled, a new segment is created, and the data continues to be written.

Current Segment: This metric reflects which segment of the WAL is currently being written to. This is particularly useful for understanding the WAL's operational state and ensuring that it is functioning correctly.Metric Definition: The prometheus_tsdb_wal_writes_failed_total metric counts the total number of failed write attempts to the WAL. A failed write could occur for various reasons, such as:

Disk space issues
File system permissions errors
Hardware failures
Corrupted WAL files
panels.title: Current Log Segment Index

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_corruptions_total is useful for detecting issues with the agent’s local storage.
It helps you identify potential problems that could lead to data loss or delays in sending metrics to remote storage.
A high or increasing value in this metric indicates that the agent’s storage is becoming corrupted, which might result in missing metrics or failures in remote write operations.
panels.title: Agent Corruptions

panels.description:
Value of 1: Indicates that the agent started cleanly without encountering any issues with its local storage, such as corruptions.
Value of 0: Indicates that the agent did not have a clean start, which might suggest problems such as storage corruption, incomplete shutdowns, or other issues.
panels.title: Agent Clean Start

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_deleted_series: This metric tracks the total number of time series that have been deleted from the agent's temporary storage.
Time series are uniquely identified streams of metric data, typically defined by a metric name and a set of labels (key-value pairs).
Deletion of time series can happen due to retention settings, which ensure that the local buffer doesn't grow too large
panels.title: Agent Deleted Series

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_checkpoint_creations_total: This metric counts the total number of checkpoints that have been created by the agent. A checkpoint is a snapshot of the state of the WAL at a particular moment, allowing the agent to manage its internal state more efficiently and safely.
Each checkpoint helps in reducing the size of the WAL by allowing the agent to discard data that has already been safely persisted in the checkpoint.
panels.title: Agent Checkpoint Created

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_checkpoint_creations_total: This metric counts the total number of checkpoints that have been created by the agent. A checkpoint is a snapshot of the state of the WAL at a particular moment, allowing the agent to manage its internal state more efficiently and safely.
Each checkpoint helps in reducing the size of the WAL by allowing the agent to discard data that has already been safely persisted in the checkpoint.
panels.title: Agent Checkpoint Creation Failures

panels.description: prometheus_agent_checkpoint_deletions_total: This metric represents the total number of checkpoints that have been deleted by the agent. Each deletion typically occurs when a new checkpoint is created, and older ones are removed to maintain efficient storage usage.Each checkpoint helps in reducing the size of the WAL by allowing the agent to discard data that has already been safely persisted in the checkpoint.
panels.title: Agent Checkpoint Deletions

panels.description: prometheus_agent_checkpoint_deletions_total: This metric represents the total number of checkpoints that have been deleted by the agent. Each deletion typically occurs when a new checkpoint is created, and older ones are removed to maintain efficient storage usage.Each checkpoint helps in reducing the size of the WAL by allowing the agent to discard data that has already been safely persisted in the checkpoint.
panels.title: Agent Checkpoint Failed Deletions

panels.description:
Batch Count: This metric counts how many batches of metrics data have been successfully sent to the remote storage system.
Batching: Prometheus batches metrics before sending them over the network to improve performance. This metric helps you understand how often Prometheus is sending batches of data, giving you insights into the behavior of the remote write process.
panels.title: Prometheus remote batches count

panels.description: The total number of samples sent to remote storage.
panels.title: Prometheus Remote Samples Sent

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_samples_appended_total: This metric counts the total number of samples that have been appended to the WAL since the agent was started.
Each time a sample is scraped from a target, it is appended to the WAL before being sent to remote storage. This ensures that data is not lost in case of transient failures during the write process.
panels.title: Agent Samples Appended

panels.description:
prometheus_agent_out_of_order_samples_total: This metric counts the total number of samples that have been identified as out-of-order since the agent started. Each occurrence of an out-of-order sample increments this counter.

Out-of-Order Samples: These are samples that are received with timestamps that are earlier than previously recorded timestamps for the same time series. In Prometheus, a time series is defined by its metric name and label set, and samples must be recorded in chronological order.
panels.title: Out-of-Order Samples

panels.description:
Metric Definition: This metric tracks the total number of samples with duplicate timestamps that were encountered across all targets during scrapes. A duplicate timestamp occurs when Prometheus receives two or more samples with the same metric name, labels, and timestamp during a scrape, leading it to discard the duplicates.

Why Duplicates Occur: Duplicates typically occur when:

Targets misbehave and send multiple metrics with the same timestamp in response to a scrape.
Misconfiguration of the scraping intervals or targets.
Data push mechanisms (like using Pushgateway) send multiple samples for the same time point.
panels.title: Prometheus Duplicate Target Sample ( $interval )

panels.description:
Understanding WAL and Truncation
Write-Ahead Log (WAL): The WAL is a critical component of Prometheus's data handling mechanism. It is used to record changes to the time series data before they are flushed to long-term storage (either local or remote). The WAL helps ensure data integrity and durability.
Truncation: As data is written to the WAL, old segments that are no longer needed for recovery or are beyond the configured retention period may be truncated (deleted). This process helps manage the size of the WAL and frees up disk space.
What Does prometheus_agent_truncate_duration_seconds_count Measure?
Metric Definition: This metric counts the number of times the agent has successfully truncated the WAL and records the time taken for each truncation operation.
Count of Truncation Events: It specifically tracks how many truncation events have occurred, providing insight into how often the WAL is being cleaned up.
panels.title: Agent WAL Truncates

panels.description:
prometheus_remote_storage: Indicates that this metric is related to the remote storage features of Prometheus.
enqueue_retries_total: Specifically counts the total number of retries that have occurred when attempting to enqueue data for remote storage.
panels.title: Enqueue Retries Total

panels.description:
The desired number of shards is the target number that Prometheus calculates internally to optimize the remote write process.
Monitoring Performance: If the shards_desired metric is significantly higher than the current shards value, it might indicate that Prometheus is struggling to keep up with the data throughput and may need tuning.
Scaling: If Prometheus is handling large amounts of data, it will dynamically increase the number of shards to handle the load. Monitoring this metric helps to ensure Prometheus is effectively scaling its remote write operations.
panels.title: Prometheus Desired Shards

panels.description: maximum number of shards allowed
panels.title: Prometheus Shards Capacity

panels.description: Max Number of Shards Used
panels.title: Prometheus Shards Max Ever Used

panels.description: This metric provides the current number of active shards that are being used for remote writing. The number of shards may increase or decrease dynamically based on the load and remote write performance.
panels.title: Prometheus Shards Used
